author: Adam Boult
title: Dream job? Apply to be a professional chocolate taster
text:
Dream job? Apply to be a professional chocolate taster You could do this for cash.   5:52pm 
H ow's this for a job opportunity? MondelÄ“z International, which makes chocolate for brands including Cadbury, Milka, Prince and Oreo, is recruiting for a 'Chocolate and Cocoa Beverage Taster'. 
Interested candidates should "be able to taste chocolate and cocoa beverage products and give objective and honest feedback." 
If that sounds like something you could do, be aware that it's a part-time position that will take up just seven and-a-half hours of your time each week. 
It's based in Reading, at the university's Whiteknights campus, and the successful applicant will be working alongside 11 other panellists and a panel leader, sharing opinions and collaborating "to reach an agreement on taste." 
The job ad, which notes that its chocolate tasters are "key in helping Mondelez perfect and launch an entirely new product all over the world," lists the following as required qualifications: A passion for confectionary and taste buds for detection Honesty when it comes to giving an opinion Eager to try new inventive products A communicative personality to build great relationships with your panel A firm grasp of the English Language 
If you're interested, head over to the Mondelez International website to apply. Watch | Squirrel Steals Chocolate Bar 00:31
